commits.summary: Use Lua grammar for scripts with a shebang containing ‘lua’
commits.author: Allan Odgaard

commits.summary: Update Run command (<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌘R</kbd>) to use TextMate::Executioner
commits.author: Allan Odgaard

commits.summary: Allow block comments that do not begin at the start of a line.
commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.body: Before the line comment would catch these lines before the block comment had a chance, now we check for the block case in the line rule.

commits.summary: Add initial semantic classes.
commits.author: Michael Sheets

commits.summary: *LuaJIT* FFI `cdef [[` blocks C syntax highlighting
commits.author: Adam Strzelecki
commits.body:
Note: Currently C syntax highlighting may not work as desider because the problem described at:

http://lists.macromates.com/textmate-dev/2011-December/014662.html

commits.summary: Table field and function call syntax highlighting

commits.summary: Functions begin with parenthesis, unless first and only param is table or string.

commits.summary: Missing `not` keyword syntax highlighting
commits.author: Adam Strzelecki

commits.summary: Anonymous functions syntax highlighting
commits.author: Adam Strzelecki

commits.summary: Folding and indent based on keywords theat are at block start: `then`, `do` and `repeat`

commits.summary: Wrap `stderr` into `error` spans and add HTML header and footer.

commits.summary: • uuid used for this item was invalid (UUID characters must be [0-9A-F], this UUID ends with G) — I generated a new UUID for the item
commits.author: Allan Odgaard

commits.summary: Patch to allow foldings for local functions. From Tom Wieland.
commits.author: Michael Sheets

commits.summary: Add the following keys to the bundle’s info.plist:
commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body:
contactName:
   The full name of the contact for this bundle.
contactEmailRot13:
   A ROT13 encoded email address for the bundle contact (we obfuscate it to avoid spammers from picking up the files, seeing how bundles will often be available via anonymous svn over http).
description:
   A short description for this bundle. Do link to more info about the language (or whatever) the bundle is about. I decided on using HTML for this (but leave out the initial paragraph tag) since it seemed like overkill to run a single line of text through Markdown.pl, just to convert [foo](link) into <a href="link">foo</a>

Many of the current descriptions could use some improvements, I just wanted to get the ball rolling :)
